definition: broaden, expand one's horizons

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
boundary/scope/extent/circles/group/kingdom (taxonomy)

sentences.english: She had an eye-opening experience that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她可是開眼界了。

sentences.english: eye-opening experiences compared to the atmosphere of the other institution.
sentences.chinese: 與其他大學比起來，這裏的氛圍使人大開眼界。

sentences.english: And, especially for teenage girls, very eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 而且，特別是對年輕女孩，很開眼界。

sentences.english: The delicious food of all over the world there also lets tourists get their eyes wide open.
sentences.chinese: 中外美食更是令人大開眼界，拍手叫絕。

sentences.english: This was truly an eye-opening session.
sentences.chinese: 這是真正令人大開眼界的會議。

sentences.english: Listening to him talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 聽他談在中國的歷險令人大開眼界。
這次經歷讓我大開眼界。

sentences.english: What an eye-opener it's been for me!

sentences.chinese: 開眼界並且我非常謙卑。

sentences.english: But for some scholars, the Magdala Stone was the real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 但是在一些學者看來，抹大拉石頭是真正的大開眼界。

sentences.english: Readers will find the answers eye-opening.
sentences.chinese: 讀者會找到答案開眼界。

sentences.english: My eyes were opened when I visited this year's Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 今年的溫布爾登之行使我重開眼界。

sentences.english: To defense lawyers, the new research is eye opening.
sentences.chinese: 對於辯護律師來說，這項新研究是很讓人大開眼界的。

sentences.english: Overall, it was a very eye-opening experience.
sentences.chinese: 總的來說，這是一個非常開眼界的經驗。

sentences.english: Listening to aim talk about his adventure in China was a real eye-opener .
sentences.chinese: 聽他談在中國的歷險令人大開眼界。

sentences.english: My trip to Shenzhen was quite an eye - opener .
sentences.chinese: 我的深圳之行真令我大開眼界。

definition: unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
to envy/to admire
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
spirit/boldness/positive outlook/imposing attitude
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
experienced and knowledgeable (idiom)
to take sth for granted
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
unprecedented and never to be duplicated/the first and the last/unmatched/unique
to blush with shame (literary)
to review the old and know the new (idiom, from the Analects)/to recall the past to understand the future
lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
